elements: The Golden King had once conquered all the territories of the Earth, and all the territories of the Mansus. All his achievements had turned to dust. All except this map.
In my dreams, I've found the way to the Mirage Door, sometimes called the Formless Gate, or the Envious Door.
A nameless Tibetan monk is said to have fully understood the essence, nature and power of the world. This was his only weapon, tool, and compass.

A bewilderingly entertaining book of lies, lies of all sorts. False Histories, nonexistent Names of fraudulent Hours, countries that could not even begin to be. Of course they have to be lies, don’t they? They contradict everything you know. But… Perhaps…

When the Tower of Treasures requires emissaries - which is always - these Maidens are the first to serve. If all the Hours were killed at once, if their blood flooded the Wood, if the Glory was shattered into a thousands pinpricks of light, their facial expression would change only slightly. They make for excellent liars.
What might I become? [This slot only accepts the final stage of Ascension. If you have achieved the Sixth Mark, add your Ascension to this slot to complete a Great Work.]

The Glory rends the skin of any who would behold it, but even the Glory can be brought to mercy by the Apple-in-the-Eye, if presented with the right moment, the right companionship and the right sacrifice.

Reinterpreted into the English language and heavily annotated by Nicolas-Louis de la Caille, published posthumously by the Stargazing Society, that loosely-tied company of ambitious astronomers dedicated to the distant and enthralling Hours.
The astrologist-writer Patricia Fletcher had retired after translating the Silver Tantra into English, having burned all her works and devoted herself to a life of asceticism.
The serial killer Aritha Aruna chanted snippets of this Tantra as she plowed her way through the Land of the Great River.
The serial killer Aritha Aruna chanted snippets of this Tantra as she plowed her way through the Land of the Great River. Only a single witness testimony proves this fact.
The Crystal Tantra is accused of being a fabrication every twenty years or so.

The Crystal Tantra is accused of being a fabrication every twenty years or so. Evidently, Edward Pierce wrote it from scratch and personally inflicted every sign of age upon the manuscript as to add it to his collection of unread texts, and to spite his competitor and occasional lover Samuel Shine.
This Tantra was originally recorded, read and publicized by a member of the Stargazing Society referred to as the Heron.

This Tantra was originally recorded, read and publicized by a member of the Stargazing Society referred to as the Heron. A discursive epilogue describes their vehement refusal to ever translate the Agate Tantra, and the depths of meaning that would inevitably be lost in the process.
The Pearl Tantra is said to have never been discovered by the Stargazing Society, having been passed down in a remote Buddhist temple for centuries.

The Pearl Tantra is said to have never been discovered by the Stargazing Society, having been passed down in a remote Buddhist temple for centuries. It is said that it was originally discovered by one of the monks, who saw it written on the underside of his skin. By what means he saw it is unclear.
The only known extant copy of the Carnelian Tantra had been acquired at an auction by the middling astronomer Fergus Bell.

The only known extant copy of the Carnelian Tantra had been acquired at an auction by the middling astronomer Fergus Bell, who went on to have a prolific career as adept and astrologist. He had removed both of his eyes after reading this Tantra.
The land of Hourai and the Long that inhabit it could not have existed in any daylight History, but the jewel-fruits of its trees are sought by adepts to this day.
I must have at least one Follower to start the expedition. I can add more later.
Optionally, I can add an extra Follower now, if I think they'll be useful.
I must have at least one Funds to begin the expedition.
Optionally, I can add more Funds now, if I'm worried about running out.

The ivory point of the mountain pierces the mists. The shores, too, are white as bone or the sclera of the eye. Amongst white grass grow white trees, whose crystal fruit, in sufficient doses, may cure all diseases, or lead to enlightenment.

The handmaidens of the Tower of Treasures may be mistaken for statues, until one sees them dance. Their every movement suggests an otherworldly greatness, and in their greatness, they care for nothing. They may be shattered by the Forge, or slain by the Edge.
